author: Girish Pattanashetti
text:
Relatives share the family's grief at Hanamanthappa’s house in Hubbali on Thursday.— PHOTO: PTI

A hero’s welcome was accorded by thousands of people of Hubballi and Dharwad when the mortal remains of Lance Naik Hanamanthappa Koppad arrived in a Special Air Force plane here on Thursday night.

Thousands throng airport

While Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah flew in by a special flight to Hubballi to receive the body of the brave soldier, thousands of people gathered at the airport to pay their last respects to the soldier. Slogans like “Hanumanthappa Amar Rahe,” “Bharat Mata Ki Jai,” “Vande Mataram” rent the air as the vehicle carrying the mortal remains moved out of the airport.

Mr. Siddaramaiah announced a compensation of Rs. 25 lakh to the kin of the soldier, a government job to the soldier’s wife and a plot.

Wanted to be a soldier

A pall of gloom descended on Betadur, hometown of Hanamanthappa, after news of his death reached the village.

Hanamanthappa, who is survived by his wife and a daughter, belonged to a farming family in this village in Dharwad district of Karnataka. He walked 6 kilometres every day to study at the high school at Aralikatti village.

The youngest in the family, Hanamanthappa always wanted to be a soldier. Despite being rejected thrice in the Army recruitment rallies at Belagavi, Dharwad and Gadag, he persisted and finally managed to get into the 19 Madras Regiment 14 years ago.

He married Mahadevi (Jayashri) four years ago. Their daughter, Netra, is two years old.

His earnings helped his family build a house on a government-allotted site in the village. His last visit to Betadur was six months ago.
title: Hero’s welcome at Hubballi
